abstract.keyword: Business Groups are used when different divisions of an organization need to be tracked for reporting purposes.
abstract.note: A Default Business Group is automatically set up upon package installs. Modify the existing Business Group or continue to create a new one.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Business Groups tab in the Accounting app and click the New button.
Enter the Name for the new Business Group and click Save.
step.info: If this Business Group is the child of another Business Group, select the Parent Business Group from the lookup dialog. It is best practice to create the records starting with the highest parent record, followed by its children, when creating a hierarchy of Business Groups.

step.cmd: Optionally, enter the Default Payment Gateway. If there is no Default Payment Gateway set on the Business Group record, then the system will use the Payment Gateway set on the Store or Sales Order records.
Select the appropriate value from the Theme lookup to display the applicable logo, colors, header/footer, and contact information in the Business Group's eInvoicing portal.

Enter the necessary field values in the Invoice Display section: Display Name, Email, Phone, Homepage URL, Customer Support URL, Support URL, Mailing Address, Invoice Header, and Invoice Footer. Click Save.

taskbody.result: The newly created Business Group is available for selection via lookups for related records in the system such as items, sales orders, invoices, and receipts.
taskbody.example: There are two business entities within a 501(c)6 Professional Association that also has its own Foundation, which is listed as a 501(c)3. Both entities use the same database, but they have their own products and revenue accounts. In this case, they have separate payment gateways and a chart of accounts, for reporting purposes. Therefore, there is a need to create a Business Group for each entity.

li.note: Default GL Accounts are generated upon creating the Business Group and must be modified to match the customer's existing accounting system in order for them to be correctly mapped.
